ğ”¼â€‹fâ€‹(ğ±Â¯k,Ï„)ğ”¼ğ‘“subscriptÂ¯ğ±ğ‘˜ğœ\displaystyle\mathbb{E}f(\overline{\mathbf{x}}_{k,\tau}) â‰¤ğ”¼â€‹fâ€‹(ğ±k)âˆ’12â€‹Î·â€‹âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±Â¯k,t)âˆ¥2absentğ”¼ğ‘“subscriptğ±ğ‘˜12ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptÂ¯ğ±ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\mathbb{E}f(\mathbf{x}_{k})-\frac{1}{2}\eta\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f(\overline{\mathbf{x}}_{k,t})\right\rVert}^{2} (219)
âˆ’12â€‹nâ€‹Î·â€‹âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,t(i))âˆ¥212ğ‘›ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\quad-\frac{1}{2n}\eta\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\sum_{i\in[n]}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,t}\right)\right\rVert}^{2} (220)
+12â€‹nâ€‹Î·â€‹âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±Â¯k,t)âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,t(i))âˆ¥212ğ‘›ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptÂ¯ğ±ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\quad+\frac{1}{2n}\eta\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\sum_{i\in[n]}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f(\overline{\mathbf{x}}_{k,t})-\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,t}\right)\right\rVert}^{2} (221)
+âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1Î·2â€‹L2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥1nâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]âˆ‡~â€‹fiâ€‹(ğ±k,t(i))âˆ¥2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1superscriptğœ‚2ğ¿2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›~âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\quad+\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\eta^{2}\frac{L}{2}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i\in[n]}\widetilde{\nabla}f_{i}\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,t}\right)\right\rVert}^{2} (222)
â‰¤ğ”¼â€‹fâ€‹(ğ±k)âˆ’12â€‹Î·â€‹âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±Â¯k,t)âˆ¥2absentğ”¼ğ‘“subscriptğ±ğ‘˜12ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptÂ¯ğ±ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\mathbb{E}f(\mathbf{x}_{k})-\frac{1}{2}\eta\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f(\overline{\mathbf{x}}_{k,t})\right\rVert}^{2} (223)
âˆ’Î·â€‹(12â€‹nâˆ’12â€‹nâ€‹Lâ€‹Î·âˆ’1nâ€‹L2â€‹Ï„â€‹(Ï„âˆ’1)â€‹Î·2)â€‹âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,t(i))âˆ¥2ğœ‚12ğ‘›12ğ‘›ğ¿ğœ‚1ğ‘›superscriptğ¿2ğœğœ1superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\quad-\eta\left(\frac{1}{2n}-\frac{1}{2n}L\eta-\frac{1}{n}L^{2}\tau(\tau-1)\eta^{2}\right)\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\sum_{i\in[n]}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,t}\right)\right\rVert}^{2} (224)
+Î·2â€‹L2â€‹Ïƒ2nâ€‹Ï„+Î·3â€‹Ïƒ2nâ€‹(n+1)â€‹Ï„â€‹(Ï„âˆ’1)2â€‹L2.superscriptğœ‚2ğ¿2superscriptğœ2ğ‘›ğœsuperscriptğœ‚3superscriptğœ2ğ‘›ğ‘›1ğœğœ12superscriptğ¿2\displaystyle\quad+\eta^{2}\frac{L}{2}\frac{\sigma^{2}}{n}\tau+\eta^{3}\frac{\sigma^{2}}{n}(n+1)\frac{\tau(\tau-1)}{2}L^{2}. (225)

8.4 Proof of Lemma 8

According to definitions in (24) and using Assumption 1 we have

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ±^k+1âˆ’ğ±Â¯k,Ï„âˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ±ğ‘˜1subscriptÂ¯ğ±ğ‘˜ğœ2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\widehat{\mathbf{x}}_{k+1}-\overline{\mathbf{x}}_{k,\tau}\right\rVert}^{2} â‰¤1n2â€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]qâ€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ±k,Ï„(i)âˆ’ğ±kâˆ¥2.absent1superscriptğ‘›2subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğœsubscriptğ±ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{n^{2}}\sum_{i\in[n]}q\,\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\mathbf{x}^{(i)}_{k,\tau}-\mathbf{x}_{k}\right\rVert}^{2}. (226)

Using the model update in (200) and Assumption 3, we can write

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ±k,Ï„(i)âˆ’ğ±kâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğœsubscriptğ±ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\mathbf{x}^{(i)}_{k,\tau}-\mathbf{x}_{k}\right\rVert}^{2} =Î·2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡~â€‹fiâ€‹(ğ±k)+âˆ‡~â€‹fiâ€‹(ğ±k,1(i))+â‹¯+âˆ‡~â€‹fiâ€‹(ğ±k,Ï„âˆ’1(i))âˆ¥2absentsuperscriptğœ‚2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥~âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ±ğ‘˜~âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜1â‹¯~âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğœ12\displaystyle=\eta^{2}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\widetilde{\nabla}f_{i}(\mathbf{x}_{k})+\widetilde{\nabla}f_{i}\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,1}\right)+\cdots+\widetilde{\nabla}f_{i}\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,\tau-1}\right)\right\rVert}^{2} (227)
=Î·2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡~â€‹fiâ€‹(ğ±k)âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k)+â‹¯+âˆ‡~â€‹fiâ€‹(ğ±k,Ï„âˆ’1(i))âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,Ï„âˆ’1(i))âˆ¥2absentsuperscriptğœ‚2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥~âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ±ğ‘˜âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptğ±ğ‘˜â‹¯~âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğœ1âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğœ12\displaystyle=\eta^{2}\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\widetilde{\nabla}f_{i}(\mathbf{x}_{k})-\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{k})+\cdots+\widetilde{\nabla}f_{i}\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,\tau-1}\right)-\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,\tau-1}\right)\right\rVert}^{2} (228)
+Î·2â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±kâ€‹Ï„)+â‹¯+âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,Ï„âˆ’1(i))âˆ¥2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptğ±ğ‘˜ğœâ‹¯âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğœ12\displaystyle\quad+\eta^{2}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{k\tau})+\cdots+\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,\tau-1}\right)\right\rVert}^{2} (229)
â‰¤Î·2â€‹Ïƒ2â€‹Ï„+Î·2â€‹Ï„â€‹âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,t(i))âˆ¥2.absentsuperscriptğœ‚2superscriptğœ2ğœsuperscriptğœ‚2ğœsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\tau+\eta^{2}\tau\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,t}\right)\right\rVert}^{2}. (230)

Summing (230) over all workers iâˆˆ[n]ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›i\in[n] and using (226) yields

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ±^k+1âˆ’ğ±Â¯k,Ï„âˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ±ğ‘˜1subscriptÂ¯ğ±ğ‘˜ğœ2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\widehat{\mathbf{x}}_{k+1}-\overline{\mathbf{x}}_{k,\tau}\right\rVert}^{2} â‰¤qâ€‹Ïƒ2nâ€‹Ï„â€‹Î·2+qâ€‹1n2â€‹Ï„â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,t(i))âˆ¥2,absentğ‘superscriptğœ2ğ‘›ğœsuperscriptğœ‚2ğ‘1superscriptğ‘›2ğœsuperscriptğœ‚2subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq q\frac{\sigma^{2}}{n}\tau\eta^{2}+q\frac{1}{n^{2}}\tau\eta^{2}\sum_{i\in[n]}\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,t}\right)\right\rVert}^{2}, (231)

as desired in Lemma 8.

8.5 Proof of Lemma 9

The steps to prove the bound in (142) for strongly convex losses in Lemma 4 can also be applied for non-convex losses. That is, we can use (142) and together with (230) conclude the following:

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ±^k+1âˆ’ğ±k+1âˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ±ğ‘˜1subscriptğ±ğ‘˜12\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\widehat{\mathbf{x}}_{k+1}-\mathbf{x}_{k+1}\right\rVert}^{2} â‰¤1râ€‹(nâˆ’1)â€‹(1âˆ’rn)â€‹4â€‹(1+q)â€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]âˆ¥ğ±k,Ï„(i)âˆ’ğ±kâˆ¥2absent1ğ‘Ÿğ‘›11ğ‘Ÿğ‘›41ğ‘subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğœsubscriptğ±ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{r(n-1)}\left(1-\frac{r}{n}\right)4(1+q)\sum_{i\in[n]}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\mathbf{x}^{(i)}_{k,\tau}-\mathbf{x}_{k}\right\rVert}^{2} (232)
â‰¤1râ€‹(nâˆ’1)â€‹(1âˆ’rn)â€‹4â€‹(1+q)â€‹{nâ€‹Ïƒ2â€‹Ï„â€‹Î·2+Ï„â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆ[n]âˆ‘t=0Ï„âˆ’1âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±k,t(i))âˆ¥2}.absent1ğ‘Ÿğ‘›11ğ‘Ÿğ‘›41ğ‘ğ‘›superscriptğœ2ğœsuperscriptğœ‚2ğœsuperscriptğœ‚2subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğœ1superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptsuperscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{r(n-1)}\left(1-\frac{r}{n}\right)4(1+q)\left\{n\sigma^{2}\tau\eta^{2}+\tau\eta^{2}\sum_{i\in[n]}\sum_{t=0}^{\tau-1}\mathinner{\!\left\lVert\nabla f\left({\mathbf{x}}^{(i)}_{k,t}\right)\right\rVert}^{2}\right\}. (233)

9 Additional Numerical Results

To further illustrate the practical performance of the proposed FedPAQ method, in this section we provide more numerical results using different and more complicated datasets and model parameters. The network settings, communication and computation time models remain the same as those in Section 5. The following figures demonstrate the training time corresponding to the following scenarios:

  • â€¢

    Figure 2: Training time of a neural network with four hidden layers and more than 248248248K parameters over 101010K samples of the CIFAR-10 dataset with 101010 labels.

  • â€¢

    Figure 3: Training time of a neural network with one hidden layer over 101010K samples of the CIFAR-100 dataset with 100100100 labels.

  • â€¢

    Figure 4: Training time of a neural network with one hidden layer over 101010K samples of the Fashion-MNIST dataset with 101010 labels.

Similar to Section 5.2, in all of the above scenarios, the data samples are uniformly distributed among n=50ğ‘›50n=50 nodes. We also keep the communication-computation ratio and the batchsize to be Ccomm/Ccomp=1000/1subscriptğ¶commsubscriptğ¶comp10001C_{\texttt{comm}}/C_{\texttt{comp}}=1000/1 and B=10ğµ10B=10 respectively, and finely tune the stepsize for every training.
